Caption: Crimson underwing, Eribidae family [confirmation required]
Description: The Eribidae family of moths falls under the superfamily Noctuoidea. According to Wikipedia, it is among the largest families moths. The family includes underwings, litter moths, tiger, lichen, and wasp moths, among many others. The largest moths can have 127 mm wingspan (in the black witch), while the smallest have 6 mm wingspan. They come in all colours, from drab and dull to vivid and colourful. According to Wikipedia, moths from the family are found in all continents except Antarctica.
